page.title: 08Elizabethan Fayre,Stebbing
page.content: The Elizabethan Fayre was first organised in 1970. It is held every 4 years and it takes about a year to organise.The organisers employ about 300 people for stalls and entertainment.Twelve people organise it.50% of the people dress up.Some costumes are bought in shops.They have the Elizabethan Fayre because they want to carry on with Elizabethan life.They raise about Â£5000 every 4 years.At the Elizabethan Fayre in between 5000 and 7000 people attend in two days.Everybody makes a procession through the street.The procession is led by Queen Elizabeth in her carriage and all her ladies-in-waiting follow.There are stalls all the way along the village and the pubs are always open.
